content: The release testing post turned up a comment https://internals.rust-lang.org/t/rust-1-59-0-prerelease-testing/16196/2 about an overly aggressive lint that got disabled later in the cycle but wasn't backported it sounds like to 1.59
I saw at least one crate disable that lint, as well, which may indicate excessive noise.
Could we do a quick backport of the disable for that lint?
I'm trying to figure out what happened here
It looks like we maybe already had to do a backport into 1.58.1, but never picked it up for 1.59 then?
I always have trouble backporting subtree edits, let me see if I can pull one together
• Move non_send_fields_in_send_ty back to nursery -- this is fine for 1.59, equivalent to 1.58
• Handle implicit named arguments in useless_format also seems to be included already
so everything we backported into 1.58.1 is in 1.59, which is good
but 2d3eb5082a96f20dfeb25e8b3d0a8aa5a084e486 which was in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/93001/commits did not get backported to beta
so I think we need to backport https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-clippy/pull/8302
